## Using Git

Git is a command line version control system. We can use it from RStudio (via the "git pane" in the upper right) or from the command line (i.e. in the "Terminal" tab)

The steps to using git involve:

1. Initiate a git repository
  git init
  or click the little box in RStudio

2. Do your work
  add files
  edit files
  save files
  
3. **Add files you care about to the "stage"**
   git add yourfilename
   click to add the "stage" in RStudio

4. **Commit your changes**
   git commit -m "your message"
   click "commit" button in RStudio
